alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Livingston; Ontario; Wayne (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 9:36PM EST until February 02 at 10:30PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Wayne County in western New York... Southeastern Livingston County in western New York... Cayuga County in central New York... Ontario County in western New York... * Until 1030 PM EST. * At 935 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Lysander to near Geneseo, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 40 and 42. Locations impacted include... Geneva, Canandaigua, Dansville, Conesus, Bristol, Phelps, Weedsport, Naples, Rushville and Honeoye. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
